sections.heading: ISC
sections.content:
The Information Security Certification (ISC) is a non-profit organization that provides security training for the candidates and provides certification. ISC is based in United States which has its offices in London, Hong Kong and many other places from more than 160 countries. Common Body of Knowledge is the core of ISC certification program which is a framework for defining industry standards and security principles.

A typical ISC certification starts with SSCP certification. This certification is only valid if the candidate has proper experience. But if the candidate is granted with Associate Level certification, he/she can add it to his/her professional career without prior experience. The candidates who are certified in SSCP will then be moved to CISSP and then specialize in security architecture, security engineering or security management etc.

sections.heading: GMAT
sections.content: GMAT is the only standardized exam to get admission into graduate business and management programs. Many organisations trust this examination and certification as set such standards in the academic performance. GMAT is a 31/2 hour standard examination structure which is designed for 2,00,000 test-takers annually. GMAT is considered as the hardest exam and takes high efforts to score good in the qualifying examination.

sections.heading: What Is GMAT?
sections.content: GMAT is Graduate Management Admission Test which is important part of business school admission process. The examination is a multiple choice computer based examination. The candidate who qualifies in GMAT is eligible to get admission in Graduate Business Schools globally. GMAT score is considered along with the academic records when taking admission in business school.

subsections.title: Analytical Writing Assessment:
subsections.content: This test is conducted for 30 minutes which allows business schools to analyse your writing skills. A brief argument paragraph should be submitted which is similar to critical reasoning which is seen in the verbal section.

subsections.title: Integrated Reasoning:
subsections.content: In this session you will find multi-source reasoning, graphics interpretation, two part analyses, and table analysis questions for which 30 minutes time is given. For this the score range is 1 to 8.

subsections.title: Quantitative:
subsections.content: In this session you will find data sufficiency questions and problem solving questions for which 62 minutes is given and the score range is 0 to 60.

subsections.title: Verbal:
subsections.content: In this session you will find reading comprehension questions, critical reasoning questions and sentence correction questions which are conducted for 65 minutes. The score range will be given as 0 to 60.

sections.heading: Important Things To Know About GMAT
list: GMAT is the hardest certification says test-takers
Unique computer adaptive format that will not allow you to skip any single question
It is believed that 700+ is the score of top 10 percent test takers
In between 200 to 800 score is considered by many of the B-schools

sections.heading: GRE
sections.content: Graduate Record Examinations (GRE) is a standardized test which is accepted in many business school admissions. GRE is owned by Educational Testing Service (ETS). This test is offered as a computer based examination authorized by Prometric. GRE consists of algebra, geometry, arithmetic, and vocabulary sections. GRE Test is very important in today’s most demanding business schools admissions.

sections.heading: Structure Of GRE Test
sections.content: GRE Test has 3 sections they are Analytical Writing, Verbal Reasoning, and Quantitative Reasoning.

subsections.title: Analytical Writing:
subsections.content: CThis section is a computer based two different types of essays task such as issue task and argument task. In this program only few computer functions are allowed by which candidates should finish the answers.

subsections.title: Verbal Reasoning:
subsections.content: This section includes reading comprehension, critical reasoning, and vocabulary usage etc. The score for this section will be 130-170. All together there are 20 questions given in the verbal reasoning for which 30 minutes time is given.

subsections.title: Quantitative Reasoning:
subsections.content: In this section there are 20 questions to be completed in 30 minutes. All the questions will belong to high school level mathematical knowledge and basic reasoning skills. The questions in this section might be filling the blanks type or multiple choice questions.

sections.heading: Best IT Certifications
sections.content: GRE test results are a part of Business schools admission process. Before entering an MBA program GRE score is considered as the main selection criteria, but the scores cannot be considered more than 5 years. General tests will be held at most of the undergraduate institutions but computer based general test is held over 1000 location with appropriate technologies needed for the test.

sections.heading: TOEFL
content: TOEFL means Test of English as a Foreign Language which is a computer based standardised test to measure English language ability to enrol for English speaking universities. This test is one of the two major tests that are conducted for admission in foreign universities. TOEFL scores will be valid for two years for the candidates who are trying to go abroad for higher studies or work.

TOEFL is introduced in countries like United States, Canada, France, Germany, and Italy. TOEFL iBT test score will be counted on the scale of 0 to 120 points. Among the four sections, each section scores 0 to 30. For every task there is ten minutes break and to complete the examinations test takers will have 203 minutes all together.

subsections.title: Reading:
subsections.content: It consists of 3 to 4 passages with 10 questions. Students should answer main ideas, details, vocabulary, purpose and overall ideas. Prior knowledge on subject is an added advantage.

subsections.title: Listening:
subsections.content: It consists of 2 to 3 conversations with 5 questions each. Each conversation is played only once. Test takers may take a note of the conversation and later answer to the questions followed after the conversations. This category can measure the capability of understanding main ideas, relationship between ideas, speaker purpose, speaker attitude, implications etc.

subsections.title: Speaking:
subsections.content: This section consists of 4 tasks among them one is individual task and other three are integrated tasks. In task one question will be depending on the familiar topics only. For other 3 tasks, test takers listen to an academic course lecture and then answer the questions about what they heard.

subsections.title: Writing:
subsections.content: In this section there are two tasks in which one is integrated and one is independent. For integrated task, test takers should listen to an academic passage and then answer with a summary about important points. In independent task the test takers must write an essay on their choice and explain it.
